intro: Russelia longipedunculata, commonly known as the purpletop russelia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of purple and pink. The plant features elongated peduncles, which are the flower-bearing stalks, giving it its species name. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardeners. Its nectar-rich flowers attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds.
